abstract.text: The remaining time in the particle’s life span, in seconds.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This property’s value is a floating-point scalar (an
object for particle property controllers, or a single
value for particle event or modifier blocks).
SceneKit initializes this value using the particle system’s
properties, then decreases the value when rendering each frame. When the life value reaches
, the particle dies (that is, SceneKit no longer simulates or renders it). Particle property controllers can use this property’s value as an input, but not change it.

abstract.text: An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions, and easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.
An object that animates and renders a system of small image sprites using a high-level simulation whose general behavior you specify.
Keys identifying properties of individual particles, used by the
dictionary and the
and
methods.
The rotation angle, in radians, of the particle about its axis.
The particle’s angular velocity (or rate of spin), in radians per second.
The particle’s restitution coefficient.
The particle’s electric charge, in coulombs.
The particle’s tint color, as a vector of red, green, blue, and alpha component values.
The normal vector, in scene coordinate space, of a collision between a particle and a geometry in the scene.
The location, in scene coordinate space, of a collision between a particle and a geometry in the scene.
The current frame index of the particle’s image animation.
The rate, in frames per second, of the particle’s image animation.
The particle’s friction coefficient.
The remaining time in the particle’s life span, in seconds.
The particle’s opacity (or alpha value).
The particle’s position vector in scene coordinate space.
The particle’s axis of rotation, expressed as a vector in the particle’s local coordinate space.
The width and height of the rendered particle image, in units of scene coordinate space.
The particle’s velocity vector in units (of scene coordinate space) per second.
Adds a block that modifies particle properties, to be executed each time SceneKit renders a frame.
Adds a block that modifies particle properties, to be executed at a specified event in the lifetimes of particles in the system.
The duration, in seconds, for which each particle is rendered before being removed from the scene. Animatable.
The range, in seconds, of randomized particle life spans. Animatable.
A dictionary that optionally associates particle properties with objects that animate a property’s value for each particle.
